data.title: Former countries in South America
data.text:
1.

Kingdom of Cusco

Former country

Overview: The Kingdom of Cusco (sometimes spelled Cuzco and in Quechua Qosqo or Qusqu) was a small kingdom based in the city of Cusco, Peru, on the Andean mountain ranges that began as a small city-state founded ...

0 0

2.

Gran Colombia

Former republic

Overview: Gran Colombia ( "Greater Colombia") is the name historians use to refer to the state that encompassed much of northern South America and part of southern Central America from 1819 to 1831. The state ...

0 0

3.

Sapa Inca

Emperor of the Inca Empire (Tawantinsuyu)

Overview: The Sapa Inca (Hispanicized spelling), Sapan Inka or Sapa Inka (Quechua for "the only Inca"), also known as Apu ("divinity"), Inka Qhapaq ("mighty Inca"), or simply Sapa ("the only one"), was the ruler ...

0 0

4.

Peru–Bolivian Confederation

State in western South America from 1836 to 1839

Overview: The Peru–Bolivian Confederation was a short-lived state that existed in South America between 1836 and 1839. The country was a loose confederation between the states of Peru, divided into the Republic ...

0 0

5.

Moche culture

Culture that flourished 100 to 700 AD in Peru

Overview: The Moche civilization (alternatively, the Mochica culture or the Early, Pre- or Proto-Chimú) flourished in northern Peru with its capital near present-day Moche, Trujillo, Peru from about 100 to 700 AD ...

0 0

7.

Jungle Nation

Short-lived unrecognized state in South America

Overview: The Jungle Nation, also known as the Jungle Republic, was an unrecognised state, that existed between 1899 and 1900, in the modern territory of Peru, within the departaments of Loreto, San Martín, and ...

0 0

9.

Wari Empire

Former country

Overview: The Wari Empire was a political formation that emerged around 600 AD in the central highlands of Peru and lasted for about 500 years, to 1100 AD. It operated about the same time as the Tiwanaku culture ...

0 0

10.

Republic of Independent Guiana

Former country in South America

Overview: The Republic of Independent Guiana (French: La République de la Guyane indépendante) commonly referred to by the name of the capital Counani (rendered "Cunani" in Portuguese by the Brazilians), was a ...

0 0

11.

Tiwanaku empire

Pre-Columbian polity in Western Bolivia

Overview: The Tiwanaku state (Spanish: Tiahuanaco or Tiahuanacu) was a Pre-Columbian polity in western Bolivia based in the southern Lake Titicaca Basin. Tiwanaku was one of the most significant Andean civilizations ...

0 0

12.

Republic of Acre

1899-1903 separatist republic in South America

Overview: The Republic of Acre (Portuguese: República do Acre, Spanish: República del Acre) or the Independent State of Acre (Portuguese: Estado Independente do Acre, Spanish: Estado Independiente del Acre) were ...

0 0

13.

United Provinces of New Granada

Period of Colombian statehood from 1810 to 1816

Overview: The United Provinces of New Granada was a country in South America from 1811 to 1816, a period known in Colombian history as the Patria Boba. It was formed from areas of the New Kingdom of Granada, roughly ...

0 0

14.

Republic of North Peru

Constituent republic of the Peru-Bolivian Confederation (1836–1839)

Overview: The Republic of North Peru was one of the three constituent Republics of the short-lived Peru–Bolivian Confederation of 1836–1839.

0 0

16.

Dutch colonisation of the Guianas

1581–1975 colonisation in South America

Overview: Dutch colonisation of the Guianas—the coastal region between the Orinoco and Amazon rivers in South America—began in the early 16th century. The Dutch originally claimed all of Guiana (also called De wilde ...

0 0

17.

Argentine Confederation

1831–1861 republic in South America

Overview: The Argentine Confederation (Spanish: Confederación Argentina) was the last predecessor state of modern Argentina; its name is still one of the official names of the country according to the Argentine ...

0 0

18.

Viceroyalty of New Granada

Viceroyalty of the Spanish Empire (1717–1819)

Overview: The Viceroyalty of New Granada (Spanish: Virreinato de Nueva Granada ) was the name given on 27 May 1717, to the jurisdiction of the Spanish Empire in northern South America, corresponding to modern C ...

0 0

19.

United Provinces of the Rio de la Plata

Federation of former Spanish Empire provinces in South America (1810-1831)

Overview: The United Provinces of the Río de la Plata (Spanish: Provincias Unidas del Río de la Plata), earlier known as the United Provinces of South America (Spanish: Provincias Unidas de Sudamérica), a union ...
